1.q_string: What is used to measure a small resistance \(\sim 10^{-5} \Omega\)?

The threshold frequency for a metallic surface corresponds to an energy of \(6.2 eV\) and the stopping potential for a radiation incident on this surface is \(5 V\). Where will be the incident radiation lies?

In a photoemissive cell, with exciting wavelength \(\lambda\), the fastest electron has speed \(v\). If the exciting wavelength is changed to \(\frac{3 \lambda}{4}\), the speed of the fastest emitted electrons will be:
When an electron in hydrogen atom is excited, from its 3rd to 4th stationary orbit, what will be the change in angular momentum of electron?
What is the order of the size of an atom?
The nucleus of which of the following atoms whose atomic mass numbers '\(A\)' are given in the options would have the highest binding energy per nucleon?
If we apply law of conversion of energy to electromagnetic induction then electrical energy induced in a conductor comes from ______________.
If number of turns per unit length of a solenoid is doubled then what will become its self inductance?
What is used as a fuel in nuclear reactors?

q_option: Depends on quantities other than quantities provided.
1.q_string: A conductor follows Ohm's law under specific conditions of voltage applied and current. If the potential applied is \(\mathrm{2~V}\) then, the increase in the value of current will be:
What is the direction of the electric field intensity at a point due to an infinitely long straight uniformly positive charged wire?
The electric field due to an infinitely long straight uniformly charged wire at a distance \(\mathrm{r}\) is directly proportional to:

Correct the following wave with its wavelength,

Type of WaveWavelength
     A. Light visible by humans1. \(1 mm\) to \(700 nm\)
B. X-Rays   2. \(700 nm\) to \(400 nm\)
C. Infrared3. \(1 nm\) to \(10^{-3} nm\)
_______________ electromagnetic waves has the longest wavelength.
What is the spectrum of X-rays?
The difference in the effective capacity of two similar capacitors when joined in series and then in parallel is \(6 \mu F\). The capacity of each capacitor is:
By what factor, the electric force between two electrons greater than the gravitational force between them?
Calculate the linear charge density when an infinite line charge produces a field of \(9 \times 10^4 \mathrm{~N} / \mathrm{C}\) at a distance of \(2 \mathrm{~cm}\).

q_option: \(\frac{q v B}{m}\)
\(\frac{q B}{m}\)
\(\frac{q B}{m v}\)
\(\frac{m}{q v B}\)
1.q_string: A charged particle of charge \(q\) and mass \(m\) is moving in a magnetic field \(B\) with a velocity \(v\). If the velocity is perpendicular to the magnetic field then what will be the acceleration of the charged particle?

Two alpha particles are moving perpendicular to the magnetic field and the radius of the circular path is \(r_{1}\) for the the particle moving with speed \(v_{1}\) and \(r_{2}\) for the particle moving with speed \(v _{2}\). What will happen if \(v _{1}\) is greater than \(v _{2}\)?

q_option: The magnetic field due to current carrying conductor lie in a plane parallel to the conductor.
The magnetic field due to current carrying conductor is uniform in a plane perpendicular to the conductor.
The magnetic field due to current carrying conductor is non uniform in a plane perpendicular to the conductor.
The magnetic field due to current carrying conductor is zero in a plane perpendicular to the conductor.
1.q_string: Which of the following is the correct statement?
What will be the angular frequency of the oscillation for the circuit shown in the figure?

Initially, an LC circuit is open and the charge on the capacitor is \(2 \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{C}\). If the natural frequency of the circuit is \(4 \times 10^{3} \mathrm{rad} / \mathrm{sec}\), when the circuit is closed, then what will be the maximum current flowing through the circuit ?
Which of the following is/are diamagnetic?

Ray of light is parallel to the wavefront
Ray of light is tangential to the wavefront
Ray of light coincides exactly with the wavefront
1.q_string: What is the relation between wavefront and the ray of light in Huygens principle?
Two coherent waves are \(y_{1}=a \cos (\omega t)\) and \(y_{2}=2 a \cos (\omega t)\). If the two waves undergo constructive interference, then what will be the resultant amplitude?

A ray incident at a point at an angle of incidence \(60^{\circ}\) enters a glass sphere of \(\mu=\sqrt{3}\) and is reflected and refracted at the further surface of the sphere. What is the angle between the reflected and refracted rays at this surface?

q_option: Electrons move from lower energy level to higher energy level in the conduction band.
Electrons move from higher energy level to lower energy level in the conduction band.
Holes in the valence band move from higher energy level to lower energy level.
1.q_string: When electric field is applied across a semiconductor:

q_option: 1: Zener diode, 2: Photo diode, 3: LED diode, 4: Junction diode
1: LED diode, 2: Junction diode, 3: Zener diode, 4: Photo diode
1: Photo diode, 2: LED diode, 3: Junction diode, 4: Zener diode
1: Junction diode, 2: Zener diode, 3: Photo diode, 4: LED diode
1.q_string: Select the correct option of the following elements from 1 to 4.

A double convex lens, made of a material of refractive index \(\mu_1\), is placed inside two liquids of refractive indices \(\mu_2\) and \(\mu_3\), where \(\mu_2>\mu_1>\mu_3\). A wide, parallel beam of light is incident on the lens from the left .The lens will give rise to:
